reviews.review_msg: Really helpful and friendly prof for an online class.

Awesome professor, even in distance ed. classes her instructions are clear, respond to email regularly. Fair marking, generally cares about student well being, exactly the kind of teacher that's needed in this department. Best of luck to her doctoral  program.

He was an okay prof, took POL 222 and gave me quite a lot of tips. I did terribly on the midterm, so if you're not satisfied with a mark he gives you then go and talk to him and he can give you some really helpful advise. It helped me at least. Be sure e-mail him often if you don't get something as well, he's very willing to help.

took over for Prof Erickson when she injured knee. did good job considering short notice.  did not teach, just read off his own notes. tests were fair and fairly marked. will improve as time moves on.
His reviews for Douglas College are much more accurate. Save yourself.
Great prof! Though this class was blended (online/in person). I had few struggles with the materials and assignments given. If you have the chance definitely take a class with Andy!

Andy is a tremendous professor. He is enthusiastic about the material and makes learning politics a delight. He is approachable and knowledgeable with plenty of experience. He explains tests and papers thoroughly and makes lectures interesting and enjoyable. Would definitely recommend.

One of my fav poli sci profs. His class is not that much of a workload but keeping up with the readings/lectures is necessary as it will be a lot to cram for if you do not. I found his marking to be fair and he was always willing to help students if they needed help.

One of my favourite POL classes so far. Gives great additional feedback on assessments when you request it. You must work hard for your grade but I believe Prof Heard is a fair grader over all. Assessments are lecture and textbook based. Overall I really enjoyed the material in this course as well as the professor.

Andrew was an amazing professor. He's very caring about his students and want everyone to succeed in his class. His exams are very heavily based on lectures and readings. I would take another class with Andrew again.
One of the best profs at SFU. Caring and tries to make the class as interesting as he can. Posts the lectures online as well so you can re watch before the midterm or final.
A easy prof to follow. Made Canadian politics interesting and linked it to current events. Not a hard marker.

Her English is fine and unaccented and yet she has never put together a coherent sentence. Her slides make no sense, and her words accompanying them in lecture aren't much better. Had to google most of the terms to understand what we were learning. She gives minimal assignment instructions and even though the concepts are easy, she makes it hard.
Very helpful prof. The info needed for midterm was all in the notes and reading. Everything was pretty clear and she's very aproachable if you need help. Would definatly take a class with her again.
The class was very easy, felt she could've pushed us a bit more.
awful...lectures were dry and boring and she talked with the TA during the ENTIRE midterm so i could barely concentrate...interesting course but she doesn't contribute much to its enjoyment
